content: Fun! I'm pretty sure defender and the index service are disabled, and I thought all the mspdbsrv issues had been resolved. It's hard to imagine what it could possibly be in conflict with.
I noticed another instance, so I opened #88924 to track this and monitor if it continues.
Just a heads up, this has caused about 10 CI failures in the past 24 hours.

I've pinged someone on the GitHub side to see if we can get eyes on this more quickly. Let's see if we have any success. I don't personally know how I'd go about investigating this without having access to the runner to try to reproduce live with process explorer. It'll probably be best to have someone from GitHub who can help us take a look.

It's being looked into here: https://github.com/actions/virtual-environments/issues/4086

Latest update:

We have disabled an internal monitor. Could you please rerun builds and check results?

Should be fixed now:

the engineering team identified the root cause and rolled back the changes a couple of hours ago. Sorry for the inconvenience.
